justification: “This scale measures the extent to which individuals identify with left and right ideologies across social (norms and hierarchies) … in India.”
The Political Ideology Scale is said to cover “the second factor of obedience in hierarchical authority,” treated as a separate sub-scale with high internal consistency (ɑhierarchies = .93).

The authors note “a third factor consists of economic ideology, which includes themes relating to whether the state should interfere in the economy and businesses,” measured within the same Political Ideology Scale.

measured_by: Interpersonal Reactivity Index – Empathetic Concern subscale (7-item)
justification: “A 7-item measure from the longer Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI; Davis, 1980) … was used to measure empathetic concern.”

measured_by: Modified IRI Empathetic Concern scale (out-group version)
justification: The IRI items were “modified … to measure the extent of concern for out-group (ɑ = .72).”

measured_by: Modified IRI Empathetic Concern scale (in-group version)
justification: The same 7-item set was “modified … to measure the extent of concern for … in-group members (ɑ = .53).”

measured_by: Balanced Inventory of Desirable Responding Short Form (BIDR-16) – SDE
justification: BIDR-16 “provides separate scores for two dimensions of social desirability-Self-Deceptive Enhancement (SDE; ɑ = .70).”

measured_by: Balanced Inventory of Desirable Responding Short Form (BIDR-16) – IM
justification: The same scale also yields “Impression Management (IM; ɑ = .55)” as a distinct dimension.

measured_by: Modified sacrificial moral dilemmas (Transplant, Fumes, Burning Building) with monetary willingness scale
justification: “Participants were presented with modified versions of three dilemmas: Transplant, Fumes, and Burning Building … along with a scale to measure to what degree they are willing to make a utilitarian … choice.”
